attr.q: You might think (as I did, originally) that the requirement that a homomorphism of monoids preserve the unit is redundant. After all, we know that for all a h a * h e = h (a * e) = h a So h e acts like a right unit (and, by analogy, as a left unit). The problem is that h a, for all a might only cover a sub-monoid of the target monoid. There may be a "true" unit outside of the image of h. Show that an isomorphism between monoids that preserves multiplication must automatically preserve unit.
attr.a: Because there won't be a sub-monoid in isomorphic relation.
